00088 DdNode *
00089 Cudd_bddLiteralSetIntersection(
00090   DdManager * dd,
00091   DdNode * f,
00092   DdNode * g)
00093 {
00094     DdNode *res;
00095 
00096     do {
00097         dd->reordered = 0;
00098         res = cuddBddLiteralSetIntersectionRecur(dd,f,g);
00099     } while (dd->reordered == 1);
00100     return(res);
00101 
00102 } /* end of Cudd_bddLiteralSetIntersection */

00109 
00123 DdNode *
00124 cuddBddLiteralSetIntersectionRecur(
00125   DdManager * dd,
00126   DdNode * f,
00127   DdNode * g)
00128 {
00129     DdNode *res, *tmp;
00130     DdNode *F, *G;
00131     DdNode *fc, *gc;
00132     DdNode *one;
00133     DdNode *zero;
00134     unsigned int topf, topg, comple;
00135     int phasef, phaseg;
00136 
00137     if (f == g) return(f);
00138 
00139     F = Cudd_Regular(f);
00140     G = Cudd_Regular(g);
00141     one = DD_ONE(dd);
00142 
00143     /* Here f != g. If F == G, then f and g are complementary.
00144     ** Since they are two cubes, this case only occurs when f == v,
00145     ** g == v', and v is a variable or its complement.
00146     */
00147     if (F == G) return(one);
00148 
00149     zero = Cudd_Not(one);
00150     topf = cuddI(dd,F->index);
00151     topg = cuddI(dd,G->index);
00152     /* Look for a variable common to both cubes. If there are none, this
00153     ** loop will stop when the constant node is reached in both cubes.
00154     */
00155     while (topf != topg) {
00156         if (topf < topg) {      /* move down on f */
00157             comple = f != F;
00158             f = cuddT(F);
00159             if (comple) f = Cudd_Not(f);
00160             if (f == zero) {
00161                 f = cuddE(F);
00162                 if (comple) f = Cudd_Not(f);
00163             }
00164             F = Cudd_Regular(f);
00165             topf = cuddI(dd,F->index);
00166         } else if (topg < topf) {
00167             comple = g != G;
00168             g = cuddT(G);
00169             if (comple) g = Cudd_Not(g);
00170             if (g == zero) {
00171                 g = cuddE(G);
00172                 if (comple) g = Cudd_Not(g);
00173             }
00174             G = Cudd_Regular(g);
00175             topg = cuddI(dd,G->index);
00176         }
00177     }
00178 
00179     /* At this point, f == one <=> g == 1. It suffices to test one of them. */
00180     if (f == one) return(one);
00181 
00182     res = cuddCacheLookup2(dd,Cudd_bddLiteralSetIntersection,f,g);
00183     if (res != NULL) {
00184         return(res);
00185     }
00186 
00187     /* Here f and g are both non constant and have the same top variable. */
00188     comple = f != F;
00189     fc = cuddT(F);
00190     phasef = 1;
00191     if (comple) fc = Cudd_Not(fc);
00192     if (fc == zero) {
00193         fc = cuddE(F);
00194         phasef = 0;
00195         if (comple) fc = Cudd_Not(fc);
00196     }
00197     comple = g != G;
00198     gc = cuddT(G);
00199     phaseg = 1;
00200     if (comple) gc = Cudd_Not(gc);
00201     if (gc == zero) {
00202         gc = cuddE(G);
00203         phaseg = 0;
00204         if (comple) gc = Cudd_Not(gc);
00205     }
00206 
00207     tmp = cuddBddLiteralSetIntersectionRecur(dd,fc,gc);
00208     if (tmp == NULL) {
00209         return(NULL);
00210     }
00211 
00212     if (phasef != phaseg) {
00213         res = tmp;
00214     } else {
00215         cuddRef(tmp);
00216         if (phasef == 0) {
00217             res = cuddBddAndRecur(dd,Cudd_Not(dd->vars[F->index]),tmp);
00218         } else {
00219             res = cuddBddAndRecur(dd,dd->vars[F->index],tmp);
00220         }
00221         if (res == NULL) {
00222             Cudd_RecursiveDeref(dd,tmp);
00223             return(NULL);
00224         }
00225         cuddDeref(tmp); /* Just cuddDeref, because it is included in result */
00226     }
00227 
00228     cuddCacheInsert2(dd,Cudd_bddLiteralSetIntersection,f,g,res);
00229 
00230     return(res);
00231 
00232 } /* end of cuddBddLiteralSetIntersectionRecur */
